newsitem.title: USA: Conrail Connecticut partner begins service.
newsitem.headline: Conrail Connecticut partner begins service.

text.p: RailTex Inc's Connecticut Southern Railroad subsidiary began operations over the weekend as a Conrail Express partner on 78 miles of rail routes through much of central and northern Connecticut, Conrail Inc said.

The routes stretch from Conrail's rail yard in West Springfield, Mass., south to Wallingford, east from Hartford to Manchester and East Windsor, and west from Windsor Locks to Suffield. Connecticut Southern's acquisition of these routes from Conrail became effective at 0700 EDT/1100 GMT Saturday, the railroad noted.
RailTex said separately it paid $3.5 million for the acquisition, which was financed using its existing $75 million acquisition facility.
In connection with the acquisition, it continued, Connecticut Southern entered into a haulage agreement with Conrail to transport some 7,350 cars annually between Springfield and New Haven.
Connecticut Southern will interchange exclusively with Conrail. -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.
